description: This is a market on whether the exhibition boxing match between Floyd Mayweather and Logan Paul will be stopped early. The match is currently set to consist of eight rounds. This market will resolve to “Yes” if the referee of the match stops and ends the fight at any time before the completion of the final round. This market will resolve to “No” otherwise. This market will resolve on completion of the match, which is scheduled to take place on June 6, 2021 at the Hard Rock Stadium in Miami. If the number of total rounds in the match changes between the creation of this market and the actual fight, the meaning of “final round” will be interpreted accordingly (e.g. if the total rounds in the match is changed from 8 to 10, “final round” will mean the 10th round). If, for any reason, this match is postponed and a new fight date is set for June 30, 2021, or earlier, the same rules for market resolution will apply for the rescheduled fight. If this match is rescheduled for any date after June 30, 2021 or canceled altogether, the market will resolve to 50-50. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, this market will be resolved in good faith at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

events.title: Will the Paul v. Mayweather fight be stopped early?

question: Will the Paul v. Mayweather fight be stopped early?
